Props to Salt & Straw for supporting the neighborhoods they open in and for redesigning their hiring process to actually help applicants be better candidates. Great model to follow in service and retail.

Human interactions create a sense of loyalty in retail experiences. We feel warm and fuzzy when we have positive interactions with people during our short lunch breaks every day. Maintaining these interactions as retail evolves is complicated and is the perfect place for human centered design, especially in dining.
“Their folly, I suspect, is they don’t understand the fundamental attraction of a restaurant. They might not even know the etymology of the word.

According to Merriam-Webster, the word “restaurant” comes from the French language, from the present participle of restaurer, meaning “to restore.” Historically, restaurants served as a restorative to weary travelers, and they function much the same way in modern society.”
As a teaching assistant in the Product Realization Lab at Stanford, I help to teach students how to design, prototype and manufacture and turn their dreams into realities.
Interning this summer with Smart Design as a Product Design Engineer and working in various stages of the design process to create beautiful and functional products, services and strategy.
Assisting in teaching a 2-week long, intensive d.school pop-up course about using design thinking to create and maintain brands.
Conducted research to help define current and future product offerings, interfaces and experiences for a diverse user group.

TA for ME101 - Visual ThinkingVisual thinking and language skills are developed and exercised in the context of solving design problems. Exercises for the mind's eye. Rapid visualization and prototyping with emphasis on fluent and flexible idea production. The relationship between visual thinking and the creative process. Taught by Purin Phanichphant and Jennifer Lopez.

Practicing sustainable food production and business to design and create delicious and visually stunning meals at the American Academy in Rome.  Meals promoted collaboration among artists and scholars at the Academy and provided an environment for them to discuss and develop ideas with each other.

My partner and I identified areas in West LA where healthy food is hard to come find.  We developed a menu and lunch service catering to people working in these "food deserts" and prepared and delivered orders to them during the work week.

Adrienne duBois
Director of Sales at Earth Island
November 10, 2011, David worked with Adrienne in the same group

I had the great fortune to collaborate with David as the co-founder of BoxedLA.  He was both analytic and artistic in that way he contributed to our business design and strategy.  He was responsible for the development of our online operations, which were very well implemented due to his technical skills and design sensibility. David approached every task with concentration, hard work and energy- and was able to work independently in a very successful manner.What sets David apart is the combination of technical expertise and artistry that he applies to both physical and conceptual problems.  He is unique in his way of thinking and was very valuable to have as a partner.
